goals__remit: The European University Foundation (EUF) is a network of universities established in 16 countries. It stands for diversity and social fairness in Higher Education (HE) and aims to accelerate the modernisation of the European Higher Education Area. The network deploys intensive cooperation and policy experimentation under five key pillars: (1) Digital Higher Education both for governance and provision of education, (2) Entrepreneurship and employability skills of graduates, (3) Policy innovation at national and European level, (4) Active citizenship of students and (5) Quality mobility for all. The network's key activities are designed to build capacity and expertise among administrative and academic staff members, to raise awareness of EU policy goals and actions and to enable policy dialogs between practitioners, policy-makers and stakeholders. The activities are underpinned by the organisation of high quality student mobility, since this is considered to be an excellent driver to implement reforms within HE.
relevant_communication:
The network is geared towards facilitating the implementation of the higher education modernisation agenda and is an incubator for policy innovation and groundbreaking European projects. 
 
Among the events carried out by the network are the following initiatives: Erasmus+ first year review, EUF Open Space, Ride for Your Rights!, summer schools, staff trainings, etc. 
 
The network also develops and maintains online tools, such the Online Learning Agreement (OLA). 
 
The EUF is involved in the following EU funded projects: Erasmus+ App, European PhD Hub, OLA+, Erasmus Without Paper 2.0, BuddySystem, SocialErasmus+, CAPQI, BEST+, #europehome, #empl-oi, HousErasmus+, eQuATIC, DoCENT, and European Student Card.
